thread.title: Saturday morning quarterback: Stars and stats from BYU's win over Cincinnati
thread.title_full: Saturday morning quarterback: Stars and stats from BYU's win over Cincinnati | Deseret News

author: Jay Yeomans
title: Saturday morning quarterback: Stars and stats from BYU's win over Cincinnati
text:
A look at how the Cougars performed in their come-from-behind win over the Cincinnati Bearcats Friday night.
Upcoming Games BYU Football BYU   Wagner @ BYU Lavell Edwards Stadium, Provo Oct. 24, 1:00 p.m. 7  Days   0  Hrs   27  Mins   17  Secs More Coverage BYU report card: Cougars beat Cincinnati in the trenches for the win BYU football video: Relive 5 key moments from the Cougars' fourth-quarter rally past Cincinnati Harmon: Resilient BYU claws back to dispatch Cincinnati 38-24 BYU football: Bronson Kaufusi and the Cougar pass rush key in the Cougars' win over Cincinnati PROVO â€” The BYU Cougars used a dominant defensive performance from the front seven as they knocked off the Cincinnati Bearcats 38-24 in LaVell Edwards Stadium Friday night.
The Cougars lived in the backfield all night long as they recorded a season-high eight sacks and recorded 12 tackles for loss in the come-from-behind win.
Scoring recap 
The Bearcats got on the board first when Andrew Gantz connected on a 29-yard field goal. One of the key plays came when Moore found Shaq Washington for a 19-yard gain.
Cincinnati pushed the lead to 10 when DJ Dowdy scored on a 1-yard reception on fourth down. One of the big plays came when Washington had a 46-yard reception on a pass from Moore on third-and-10.
BYU closed the gap to 10-3 when Trevor Samson hit a 29-yard field goal. The most important play on the possession came when Tanner Mangum hit Mitch Mathews for a 38-yard reception.
Mike Boone scored on a 5-yard run to give Cincinnati a 17-3 lead. Kevin Brown intercepted a deflected pass at the BYU 20-yard line to set up the drive.
The Cougars answered when Algernon Brown found the end zone on a 5-yard run. A 16-yard pass from Mangum to Nick Kurtz set up the score.
BYU tied the score on the first drive of the second half when Kurtz hauled in a 19-yard touchdown reception. The score was set-up by a 16-yard pass from Mangum to Colby Pearson on fourth-and-5 kept the drive alive.
The Bearcats regained the lead when Tion Green scored from 2 yards out. Cincinnati converted on a third-and-4 and a third-and-12 to on the possession.
The Cougars tied the game at 24 when Brown scored on a run from the 2-yard line. The key play on the drive came when Francis Bernard busted off a 40-yard run on second-and-10.
BYU took its first lead of the night when Kurtz scored on a 53-yard reception from Mangum. The one-play drive was set up by a great defensive stand that saw the Bearcats lose 7 yards on three plays.
The Cougars sealed the win when Bernard scored on an 11-yard run for the 38-24 lead. BYU had excellent field position to start the possession, thanks to a 39-yard punt return from Garrett Juergens.
Three stars 
3. Sione Takitaki 
Takitaki had a huge game for the Cougars. He finished with nine total tackles, including two tackles for loss.
2. Nick Kurtz 
Kurtz had his best performance as a Cougar. He had six catches for 119 yards, including touchdowns of 19 and 53 yards.
1. Bronson Kaufusi 
Kaufusi had his best outing of the season for the BYU defense. He totaled six tackles, three sacks and a forced fumble while blocking a field goal.
Analyzing the stats 
After a slow start saw him complete just 5 of 15 first-half passes, Mangum completed 14 of 17 second-half throws for 172 yards and two touchdowns.
Cincinnati finished the night with season lows of 341 yards of offense and 21 first downs. The only other game where the Bearcats had fewer than 500 yards and 30 first downs came in a 34-23 win over Miami (FL). Cincinnati also had season lows in both running and passing yards.
The Cougars carried the ball 29 times for a season-high 197 yards. Their 6.8 yards per carry are the highest total of the season and the best total since a 2013 win over Nevada.
After scoring three touchdowns during his first 23 games in a Cougar uniform, Brown has scored six touchdowns in the last two games, including two scores in the win on Friday night.
With the win over the Bearcats, BYU is now 3-0 on the season over the American Athletic Conference in 2015.
Up next 
The Cougars will square off against the Wagner Seahawks. The Seahawks are 0-5 on the season with losses to Rice, Monmouth, Lafayette, Robert Morris and Columbia.
Wagner is averaging 13 points a game on 266 yards of total offense while the defense is giving up 389.4 yards and 31.4 points.
Alex Thomson takes most of the reps at quarterback and has completed 54.7 of his passes for 491 yards and four touchdowns with three interceptions. Chris Andrews has also seen plenty of time under center and has completed 45.7 percent of his throws for 216 yards and a touchdown with four picks.
Their favorite targets in the passing game are Andre Yevchinecz and Lloyd Smith. Yevchinecz has caught 16 passes for 231 yards and two touchdowns while Smith has seven receptions for 128 yards and a score.
Matthias McKinnon is the No. 1 option in the running game with 58 carries for 295 yards. Otis Wright has also made an impact on the ground game with 35 carries for 119 yards.
Jay Yeomans is a courier by day and a freelance writer by night. He is the creator and lead writer of the website jmoneysports.com . Contact him at jmoney34@hotmail.com . Twitter: @jmoneysports
